column4: Hi everyone, I'm just wondering what the default X directory is in feisty
does anyone know the X directory as it is by default?
there is several directories for X, rephrase your question

I am trying to install my ati driver again, and it is asking me for the directory so it knows what version of xorg to use.  Here's the command line it wants me to fill out: X_VERSION=<xdir> ./ati-driver-installer-<ver>-<arch>.run [--install]
why not use the Restricted Drivers Manager? My experience is that it Just Works.
is that a new feature in fiesty?  I just upgraded a few seconds ago
great, let me give it a try
Have to download a package first.  I'll let you know in a few minutes if it worked.  Thanks for the help
proprietary ATI drivers do not support Compiz, disable them and use the FOSS ones
how do I do that?  I'm very new to linux
in proprietary drivers manager, disable flglrx
well it was "ATI accelerated graphics driver" but I think it's the same
it is. after restart, check the Desktop Effects preferences
I'll be back in a minute
